item.title: Band of Brothers star reflects on the iconic series.
item.description:
Ross McCall is a Scottish actor best known for his roles as T-5 Joseph Liebgott in the HBO miniseries ‘Band of Brothers’ and as Matthew Keller in the hit series ‘White Collar’.
In 2001 McCall would join an ensemble cast and portray Easy Company veteran Joseph Liebgott in HBO’s epic miniseries ‘Band of Brothers’. The series found immediate success and has stood the test of time as one of most pivotal and influential creative works surrounding World War II.

item.title: WWII veteran marries at 100: the first dance.
item.description:
Can you imagine getting married at 100 years old? That’s exactly what WWII Veteran Harold Terens did. We remember when both he and his wife both got to enjoy their first dance at our Annual Veterans Conference.
For the past 28 years the AVC has brought together dozens of notable veterans of the last 80 years of history for our Annual Veterans Conference, where they share their lessons and experiences with an audience of several hundred students from each of the military service academies & ROTC programs from across the country. Participants range from surviving heroes of WWII to recipients of the Medal of Honor to young Special Operations veterans of today’s military. The weekend of programming concludes with American Valor: A Salute to Our Heroes, a black-tie gala filmed as a Veterans Day television special, airing on ABC, CBS, NBC and Fox stations across the country, and to all military personnel around the world on American Forces Network. We look forward to our 28th Annual Conference & Gala this coming November!

item.title: Ball turret gunner forced to bail out of his B-17.
item.description: WWII Veteran Lester Schrenk joined the U.S. Army Air Forces on his 19th birthday in November 1942. He was assigned to the only open position left - a ball turret gunner on a B-17 bomber. He shares an experience where he was forced to bail out of his B-17 bomber.
